name: AWS Kinesis streams are not encrypted using Server Side Encryption
description: This Policy identifies the AWS Kinesis streams which are not encrypted using Server Side Encryption. Server Side Encryption is used to encrypt your sensitive data before it is written to the Kinesis stream storage layer and decrypted after it is retrieved from storage.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-kinesis-list-streams' AND json.rule = 'encryptionType equals NONE or encryptionType does not exist'
recommendation:
1. Sign in to the AWS Console
2. Go to Kinesis Service
3. Select the reported Kinesis data stream for the corresponding region
4. Under Server-side encryption, Click on Edit
5. Choose Enabled
6. Under KMS master key, You can choose any KMS other than the default (Default) aws/kinesis
7. Click Save
